title: Ultra-conservative José Antonio Kast elected Chile’s next president | Chile | The Guardian
snippet: With more than 99% of polling stations counted, Kast took 58.16% of the vote, against 41.84% for the leftist Jeannette Jara, a former labour minister under the current president, Gabriel Boric.

title: Far-right candidate Jose Antonio Kast wins Chile’s presidential election | Elections News | Al Jazeera
snippet: The tally also marks a significant comeback for Kast himself, the 59-year-old leader of the Republican Party. The 2025 election marks his third attempt to win the presidency — and his first successful bid.

title: Chile elects Kast as president in sharp rightward shift | Reuters
snippet: SANTIAGO, Dec 14 (Reuters) - Jose Antonio Kast won Chile's presidential election on Sunday, leveraging voter fears over rising crime and migration to steer the country in its sharpest rightward shift since the end of the military dictatorship ...

title: José Antonio Kast Elected President of Chile - The New York Times
snippet: With over 98 percent of the ballots counted, Mr. Kast had more than 58 percent of the vote, a resounding victory over Jeannette Jara, the candidate for the center-left and a member of the Communist Party of Chile, who had about 42 percent.

title: Chile’s Jose Antonio Kast Wins 2025 Presidential Election - Bloomberg
snippet: Ultra-conservative José Antonio Kast won Chile’s presidency by a landslide Sunday, harnessing voter anger over crime and migration to drive the country into its most dramatic rightward shift in decades.
